result.execSummary:
The defendant Norberto Rivera Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (ie bars, taverns, or liquor stores). Take all prescribed medications. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. Surcharge is imposed.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Norberto Rivera Perez in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sarah Tapia appeared as interpreter.  Interpreter is sworn-in.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/ sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Take all prescribed medications 
____No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-11-2015 09:00 am

Case called for review hearing.  Attorney Rosario does not contest findings of doctor.  State does not contest findings.
